columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to assess the rights.

The **right offering** is a public offering of shares in which existing shareholders are initially given securities. There is no additional stock issued in a rights issue, lowering a present company's ownership proportion as long as the existing shareholder exercises all of his rights to maintain an equal proportion shareholding by subscribing to new share financings at or below market rates.Â

Let us first identify the given amounts in the problem: 


| | Amount$\hspace{5pt}$| 
|:--|--:| 
|Rights-on price | $49.00|
|Ex-right price | $47.60| 
|Subscription price  |$34.00|
|Additional funds|$16.5 million|

First, let us determine the number of new shares. This is computed by dividing the additional funds by the subscription price. As an illustration, here's what it looks like: 

$$\begin{aligned}
{\text{New shares}}&=\dfrac{\text{Additional funds }}{\text{Subscription price}}\\[10pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$16.5 million }}{\text{\$34.00}}\\[10pt]
&={\text{485,294}}
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The total number of new shares is 485,294.**

Then, let us determine the number of rights required to buy stocks. 

However, as we have seen in the problem, the problem only provided us with the ex-right and the rights-on price, so we will use these data to determine the number of rights. This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Ex-rights price}&=\dfrac{\text{(RN $\times$ S) + SP}}{\text{1 + RN }}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where: 

RN = Rights needed 

S = Share price 

SP = Subscription price

We will use the formula from step 4 to compute the number of rights needed. This is computed as follows: 


$$\begin{aligned}
\text{\$47.60 }&=\dfrac{\text{(RN $\times$ \$49.00) + \$34.00}}{\text{1 + RN }}\\[10pt]
\text{\$47.60}&=\dfrac{\text{\$49.00RN + \$34.00}}{\text{1 + RN }}\\[10pt]
\text{\$47.60 + 47.60RN}&={\text{\$49.00RN + \$34.00}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Then, let us rearrange the formula by shifting the $49.00RN to another side. This is computed as follows: 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{ 47.60RN - 49.00RN}&={\text{ \$34.00 - \$47.60}}\\
\text{ -\$1.40RN}&={\text{ -\$13.60}}\\
\end{aligned}$$
**To conclude, before the offering, the company has 4,712,205 shares.**
